title: Dow rises over 100 points and Nasdaq Composite aims for 4th straight rise Thursday morning
text:
Investors appeared to be shifting their attention to corporate earnings which will unofficially kick off on Friday with major financial institutions, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPM

The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA rose 0.4% at 36,411, aiming for a third consecutive gain.

The S&P 500 index SPX was up 0.3% to around 4,739, also shooting for a third gain in a row.

The Nasdaq Composite Index COMP advanced 0.3% to around 15,241, with the technology-laden benchmark looking at its fourth consecutive gain, highlighting a stunning reversal for the index after plunging intraday Monday.

On Wednesday, the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq Compositegained ground after the December consumer-price index showed U.S. inflation running at a 7% year-over-year clip, a nearly 40-year high.

In corporate news, TPG Inc. TPG priced its initial public offering at the midpoint of its range for its trading debut Thursday on the Nasdaq some 30 years after the private-equity firm launched under the name Texas Pacific Group.
